Brooks Hall

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: the University's first museum, dedicated to natural science, and the first University building donated by an individual (Lewis Brooks of Rochester, N.Y.). The museum closed in the 1940s and the building converted to classroom space; now houses the Anthropology Department and exhibit space. -- Wilson/Neuman/Butler, The University of Virginia Campus Guide, 2nd, ed., 2012 [work]
